title: Congratulations Riot, you managed to make ADC broken
body:
When every class/role has to find a way to directly affect an ADC, you can no longer deny that the role is over tuned.

Supports shouldn't build specifically to help ADC champions, yet they do. Half the items a support builds directly affects an ADC more than any other person. Tanks that are found in Support roles, too lane or jungle now just build items that generally help the ADC. 

Congrats adc2017!

Where they can now effectively stand on one spot and blow everyone away. You barely see other roles that get this much attention

As for Pro play
Let's not forget that if we see a bot lane without an ADC anymore. Yet, seeing ADC literally sh***ing on AP mids through out early, mid, and late game is totally fine.

Watching the NA LCS this week goes a long way to show that's ADC are overtuned. They get played more because so many AP champions are no longer viable. Forget trying to kill a ADC champion with a assassin or many AP champions. The design that champions and mid champions should be able to 1v1 ADC champions is long ago

This is literally what the game intended to do since season 2. Morello had an entire thesis made on why the one with the main damage output should be the priority target at all points in the game. I don't like it either, but this is not the result of incompetence.

Morello believe in strong stun and burst options, witch mitigated the problem. Since then, the main design philosophy is that people should be able to out play stun and burst with twitch reflexes instead of just using map positioning. So burst was systematically made less bursty (takes longer), less reliable (you can dodge it), shields were made stronger and more plentiful, burst items were made weaker, and hybrid items were made more defensive. 

So no this isn't what the game intended from season two, since the stun and burst options are a shell of their former selves.
